intro: Mormolyca gracilipes, commonly known as the slender mormolyca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
